attributes.action: Update the trains used on the Central line
attributes.additional_details: In my short time living in London I have seen more than several people faint on the Central line due to heat or overcrowding. For such a busy underground line these trains should be more accommodating for the masses.
attributes.background: The current train models used on the Central line are outdated and do not offer enough space for travellers to use. The air conditioning barely works, the train cars are separated instead of being able to walk all the way through them and during the summer the heat on these trains is unbareable.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. This is the responsibility of TfL, which is accountable to the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
